website_summaries.verdict: An affordable meat thermometer and timer with a compact design and some user-friendly features.
pros: Set designed temperature and timer with this simple-to-use device
Comes with four-foot long cord for convenient usage
Adjustable screen with large numbers that are easy to see

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY THIS PRODUCT BREAKS!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this unit twice. The first one stopped working after about three months when the unit would only read "HI" and would not function. I suspected it was the probe so I bought a second unit, which was cheaper than buying the probe alone. When the new unit arrived I inserted the new probe into the old unit and sure enough it worked perfectly. The new probe worked, you guessed it for about 3-4 months and then the unit would only read "HI". I'm done, this is a great unit when it works but if you buy it you are throwing your money away. DO NOT BUY THIS PRODUCT until they fix what is clearly a poorly designed probe.
customer_reviews.author: Jill Marie

customer_reviews.title: Great design, POOR quality.
customer_reviews.text: I love this digital thermometer , why can't you make it better, and last longer. I bought it in July 2016 and it's already not working. I keep buying it because I like it.... i keep hoping I'll get one that works longer. When it works it's good for baking and also for yogurt making. The problem lies in the cord that goes from the device to the probe. You just need to make it stronger somehow. Please try to make it better quality. I'm not going to buy it again this time. Let me know when you improve the quality.
customer_reviews.author: N. garcia

customer_reviews.title: Junk compared to older models
customer_reviews.text: I purchase this just 4 months ago to replace a Taylor thermometer that I had at least 5 years. This is junk. Thermometer probe doesn’t register properly and ruined a turkey. Now timer stopped mid cooking and ruined a dozen eggs. Went to switch off and on off snapped off. And of course double checked battery and it’s fine. So angry. As a disabled person, time and energy in a kitchen is a struggle. To waste that, and the food due to faulty products infuriates me
customer_reviews.author: Grandma in Oregon

customer_reviews.title: Sensor failed --  Avoid
customer_reviews.text: I had purchased this to check whether my reconstituted milk product was the right temperature for my bottle baby goat. It worked beautiful for the first 25 to 30 times. Then suddenly, it stopped working and was registering my milk temp about 20 to 30 degrees hotter than it was. I cleaned the probe off again just in case there was residue on the probe itself. and it was registering the air at 100 degrees. Having said this, the displays were wonderful to read. Its a shame that the manufacturer allows for weak points in its item. My recommendation for others -- avoid this item and avoid disappointment when you can least afford it.
customer_reviews.author: Isthisgoodornot

customer_reviews.title: The wire breaks quickly, bad design
customer_reviews.text: I have had 2 of this last year. The idea behind it is great. I loved it when it did work. Unfortunately, they all broke within a few months. The plastic around the wire where the probe starts would break. It was like the probe had a sharp edge that slowly cut the plastic with careful use. It was very poorly designed. I have already called to use my warranty and while I was sent a new one, it quickly broke as well. I unfortunately, had given these as gifts before I realized this flaw and regret it. I wish they could find a way to fix this issue and I would buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY THIS OR THIS BEAND NAME
customer_reviews.text: Probe failed on my second use. Replacement probe cost thru Amazon almost same price as entire unit cost. Found they can be ordered from Taylor but there is no web site, you must mail them a money order or check, no Credit Card, yada, yada. Too much trouble. I always thought Taylor was a good brand name for temp management. Not true.
customer_reviews.author: Stagecoach

customer_reviews.title: Was hoping to use this for christmas dinner but it was useless. Had a temperature read out for a minute ...
customer_reviews.text: Stopped working almost immediately, first try out of the packaging. Was hoping to use this for christmas dinner but it was useless. Had a temperature read out for a minute before it stopped working. Temperature only reads Lo now.
customer_reviews.author: dinnercoffee

customer_reviews.title: Great Thermometer - Garbage Probes!
customer_reviews.text: The thermometer itself is a good product. Easy to use. Easy to adjust. Easy to read. However...the PROBE! Yes! The dastardly PROBE is absolute GARBAGE! Yes! G-A-R-B-A-G-E!!! Use the the thermometer for a couple of weeks and...the wire breaks where it inserts into the probe. Now...the whole unit becomes useless! Very frustrating because...the probes cost twice as much as the whole unit! And...I already have a few units sitting in a kitchen drawer!
customer_reviews.author: armor

customer_reviews.title: Should have listened
customer_reviews.text: I used this thermometer only 7 times since I’ve had it. Now, it’s around 100 degrees off and I can’t find any good instructions to recalibrate it as I have thrown out the manual. I went to their website and didn’t find anything their either. If someone has bought a good probe thermometer please tell me because I feel like I’ve gone through so many.
customer_reviews.author: caitlin alley

customer_reviews.title: Biggest Piece of C---P I have ever seen. The warranty is a joke!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased 12/24/18 for $15.09. Arrived 12/29/18. Used for a Christmas turkey. Kep't in the kitchen draw. Just tried to use it for the 2nd time for a Thanksgiving turkey. Registers about 30 degrees higher than what the temperature is. Verified with my instant read thermometer. Read the warranty. RETURN PREPAID TO TAYLOR. What a joke. Their product failed on the second use, still in warranty period and they want the consumer to spend between $5 and $10 to return their failed product to them for evaluation when the product retailed for $15.09. That is called a "BOGUS WARRANTY". The company is obviously not ethical.
customer_reviews.author: Gary G.

customer_reviews.title: So easy to use/read. Looks good. Highly reccomend!
customer_reviews.text: I already own one and found it on amazon for my mother and mother in law. Its incredibly easy to use and has an alert timer for the desired temp. A must have for perfect meat temperatures! I've never made better lamb chops than when I use this digital thermometer. Just make sure after you reach your temp goal you move the wand around to check the whole peice of meat/meal. So easy: set, stab, walk away and wait for the beep. The attractive stainless look is a plus.
customer_reviews.author: kam y.

customer_reviews.title: Lasted 2 months
customer_reviews.text: Purchased in December 2016, non functional by February 2017. I used this thermometer nearly daily for melting wax for my candle business. It worked quite well until the sensor stopped working, giving random temperatures from 40 degrees to 180 and back down again in a second or just displaying "LO" -- while moving the wire on the probe it worked sometimes but it seems like this one has a fault probe or a disconnect inside that cannot be replaced or fixed. I have thrown mine away and will be trying another brand.
customer_reviews.author: Kim R.

customer_reviews.title: EASY TO READ AND USE
customer_reviews.text: I use this to check temps mostly on chicken. Also, I like the easy to read numbers, and ability to set temp to desired doneness. I haven't had any trouble with this thermometer. I just run the probe under the water with a quick wipe of a sponge and its clean. It also remembers your last temp setting, even when turned off. I even tried this on a glass full of ice water and it got down to 31°, so I have nothing but great to say about this, except if you are in the market for an easy to read thermometer than this is the one to get. Great price as well, for the ease of use.
customer_reviews.author: Mitch E.

customer_reviews.title: One a year
customer_reviews.text: I like the functionality and the ease of use. But it doesn't last. I have gone through 4 of these during the last four years. Every time, the probe fails after several months of use. I have three thermometers in the kitchen drawer right now, but I don't have a probe that works. So, I am struggling with the decision of buying a better-quality replacement probe for $15, or just buying another thermometer for $10 knowing that it will fail during the next year. Why can't Taylor ship probes that last?
customer_reviews.author: SD-Brit

customer_reviews.title: The best Digital Thermometer I've ever bought
customer_reviews.text: Literally, could not be happier. I've spent at least a couple hundred on fancy thermometers from William Sonoma. Being expensive, doesn't mean it's good. They all ended up in the garbage. I picked this up for $10 and it works flawlessly. I love the strong magnet on the back, I can stick it on the fridge when not in use as a timer. Or it sticks to the stove so it won't slide off and hit the ground. Genius. Also, the buttons are prominent and quick to figure out at a glance. Highly recommend. Nobody is paying me or giving me free stuff for this review either.
customer_reviews.author: Rendon

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in order to cook a prime rib for Christmas dinner. It worked out great. The cord was a good length so I was able to place the gauge on the counter and not on my crowded stove. There is a magnet but my stove is too small for it to be placed in an easily visible spot. My only complaint is that the cord had some discoloration from the oven heat that remained after cleaning.
customer_reviews.author: Lynn

customer_reviews.title: Thermometer works fine...BUT...
customer_reviews.text: I am of two minds regarding this remote oven thermometer. On the one hand the device works fine and is logically laid out. I like that. On the other hand, despite the picture of the item being white with clear easy to read labels, we received one with a chrome finish which makes reading the external markings EXTREMELY difficult. Whatever product is sold by Amazon.com it should have an accurate picture depicting the device. If the color is catch as catch can then that should be clearly spelled. And that is done with the bulk of items on Amazon.com, which I truly appreciate, but in this case it was not done much to my shagrin...
customer_reviews.author: Peter

customer_reviews.title: Fails to display temperature.  Total failure.  Don’t buy
customer_reviews.text: Item doea not work. Even with different new batteries, temperature reading is stuck on “Lo”. I had a different Taylor thermoprobe and display/control unit like this in metal instead of plastic, which worked, so i know they can do better. Weird that the first item I bought from Amazon, after a hundred or more others, that came with a “warehouse deals inspected” sticker is the first item that arrived broken.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Failed during first use
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use with an outdoor grill. The sensor or sensor-wire apparently failed on my initial use, even though the grill cover reported that the grill temperature was 150o below the limit specified for the device. The vendor website purports to offer a way to report the problem, but it requires entry of the purchase date and the website drop-down list for the year only goes up to 2015. The website also does not offer secure entry for form-fill data, so up-to-date Firefox and Google Chrome browsers refuse to submit the form. It's obvious the website isn't being maintained.
customer_reviews.author: Baroque music lover

customer_reviews.title: Defective Probe almost out of the box. Do not buy.
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT BUY THIS THERMOMETER. THE PROBES SUPPLIED ARE KNOW DEFECTIVE AND BEING SOLD AND SHIPPED REGARDLESS. READ MORE REVIEWS THERE ARE COUNTLESS INSTANCES OF THIS EXACT ISSUE. TEMPERATURE REGISTERS AS LO. IN OTHER WORDS NO READING. NO FIX AVAILABLE BESIDES REPLACING THE PROBE. I UNDERSTAND IT IS CHEAP AND ON THE LOW END OF THERMOMETERS. I WAS EXTREMELY CAREFUL NOT TO DAMAGE THE PROBE. IT WORKED ONCE. IT WAS 5° LOW ON THE READ OUT. I COULD WORK WITH THAT FOR THE PRICE. SECOND USE THERE WAS NO TEMPERATURE READOUT. IT IS EFFECTIVELY AN OVEN TIMER ONLY. BUYER BEWARE.
customer_reviews.author: Steph S

customer_reviews.title: I've tried this twice - no more.
customer_reviews.text: I've bought two of these over time. They work fine. I never checked the actual temp as others did, but it seemed accurate enough. However the probe doesn't last long. The reason I have two is because it is just about as expensive to buy a another unit that comes with the probe as to buy just a probe! This time I'm quitting. The company has been informed many times about this problem but I guess they make enough money on their cheap product so it doesn't matter to them. I always try to move to companies that actually care about their customers. I'm moving on.
customer_reviews.author: Lily Serene

customer_reviews.title: Didn't last 8 months
customer_reviews.text: These are NOT the same quality they used to be. Had one for years, this one died in less than 8 months UPDATE - I sent an email to the company a month ago about the warranty. Nothing - so much for the one year warranty....
customer_reviews.author: John W

customer_reviews.title: love this product
customer_reviews.text: I never had a proper thermometer before and as a person who loves to cook good food, I decided that I was going to transition from eyeballing meets to knowing internal temperature. I love that you can set to internal temperature or use as timer. Sticks right on my oven door but I use with my grill as well. Had for several months and still holding up....we tend to be hard on small tools such as this, but the probe/cord has not broken, bended or frayed and the timer works like a charm....vey impressed. I will NEVER go without a thermometer like this again!
customer_reviews.author: Janice Shipe-Spotloe

customer_reviews.title: gave it 1 star because I couldn't give it a zero
customer_reviews.text: lasted all of about 10 minutes. Did not even get to 145deg for the fish I was using it on before the probe went out. Was sent back in about an hour
customer_reviews.author: ED

customer_reviews.title: Cant Leave in Oven
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to monitor the temperature inside my oven for consistency in baking macarons and other goods. But it says right on the packaging that you can't leave it in the oven. What's the frickin' point in this design, then? False advertising.
customer_reviews.author: Medic

customer_reviews.title: Probes died easily...
customer_reviews.text: I have had four of these over the years. Most recently I bought one for my parents and my brother. Both of them failed after one year with minimal use. The probes died on both of them. When I looked to replace them the probes cost 95% of the original cost. If they are going to charge that much, the probes better be a more durable item than failing right outside of one year with minimal use... Almost feels like it is intentionally cost structured so you buy an entire new set for a few more dollars. Very annoyed...
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: "Precision Products," my ass.
customer_reviews.text: Temperature is nowhere near accurate. Bought this because my candy thermometer doesn't cover the full range of what I need to be able to measure while brewing. This hits the full range, but is wildly inaccurate across all of it. Brewing a beer last night, I compared the cooling wort's temperature as measured by this thermometer to what was measured by my candy thermometer, which I have tested and found accurate in the past. This thermometer was off by NEARLY FORTY DEGREES FAHRENHEIT. Fifteen bucks down the drain.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Brian Mooney

customer_reviews.title: not accurate.
customer_reviews.text: I did not like that product was not accurate. Have used temperature signaling thermometers for several years and loved them. dropped and broke my last one, replaced it with this item which failed to correctly announce an accurate temperature. Yes I set spike deep into thick pork chops. Set thermometer to signal at 165 f. after signal sounded I let pork chops rest; meat was very pink and shedding very pink liquids when cut open. More than just rare.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra Horton

customer_reviews.title: This started out being a nice little thermometer
customer_reviews.text: This started out being a nice little thermometer, the display is clear and easily readable. The timer and temp alarms are nice and audible. However, I believe the calibration was lost during the first use... It only reached a temperature of 170 degrees and when I started to bring the temperature back down it stoped at 92 and wouldn't go any lower with a room temperature of 65 degrees. I tried resetting it, turning it off and back on and it's stuck on 92 degrees. Guess I'll look around for something with a higher rating and spend some more coin for USA made components.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan K.

customer_reviews.title: Love, but doesn't last long
customer_reviews.text: This is my favorite Thermometer to use, but every time I buy it, it only lasts about 9 months and then stops working.
customer_reviews.author: Bethany Blaine

customer_reviews.title: Taylor Precision digital cooking thermometer
customer_reviews.text: This is our second identical model Taylor cooking thermometer. The first one lasted approximately 3 years. It was used constantly in the kitchen and as a BBQ thermometer. It performed perfectly in all applications. The audible alert for the reaching the preset temperature is very nice. The timer function works well but we don't use that option very often opting instead for the timer built into the ovens. We found this device to be well suited to our needs which is why we purchase another identical unit. The first one seems to have failed due to a faulty probe wire. I felt that with the amount of use and abuse it received over the years held up really well.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Thermometer good, probe not so good
customer_reviews.text: This is my third Taylor thermometer of this model. You can buy a separate probe but for a few extra bucks you can buy the thermometer and probe. The probes keep going bad since the wire connection at the base of the probe fails with moderate use. This last one started to fail within a couple of weeks and I was gentle with it since I was aware of the problem. The braided wire probe lasted the longest but eventually went bad as well. If your thermometer read Lo on the screen this means the probe has failed.
customer_reviews.author: NLHRN

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use. This thing saved Thanksgiving for us this year. I tried a new method of cooking the turkey where you put it uncovered in a 500 degree oven to brown the skin then turn the heat down for regular roasting time. I use a stand alone roasting oven on Thanksgiving so the oven is freed up. This thermometer let me know my turkey was cooking much faster than expected. The turkey would have been done three hours early if I hadn't had this thermometer to tell me how quickly the internal temp was rising. The alarm feature for temperatures is very helpful.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Cheaper quality, hope it lasts
customer_reviews.text: I Purchased a similar model of this meat thermometer before and it stopped working after a few uses. This is the second time now I am purchasing and it seems that they have cheapened the design. The buttons are all plastic and much cheaper look and feel than before. However, this one seems to be working after the first few uses. Hope this doesn’t break like the previous meat thermometer from this brand!
customer_reviews.author: TP

customer_reviews.title: Cheap & Easy
customer_reviews.text: In the rating, it asked about accuracy...How the heck would you know unless you had 3 or more thermometers measuring the exact same point? I suppose I could heat water and look for 212 F when it begins to boil? The unit is inexpensive and seems to work just fine for my roasts and when I make my ricotta on the stove top. Winner-winner, chicken dinner.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin from CT

customer_reviews.title: Okay, With Limitations
customer_reviews.text: This registers about 2°-3° F low. I use it to know when water boils, and discovered that if you set the alarm to 212°, it never goes off, because at 212, this only registers 209-210° F. Now I set the alarm for 210°F, and it's always right. By the way, I live at sea level, in FL.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Hogenson

customer_reviews.title: watch out for the cord burning. UPDATE: customer service was great and I got a replacment quick!
customer_reviews.text: This is the second one I bought. Sadle, the cord between the metal probe and the timer melted in one place!! UPDATE: I got a replacement from the seller without any issues - thanks for the good service thank you!!
customer_reviews.author: Auntie Em

customer_reviews.title: Look after your probe
customer_reviews.text: Great little thermometer but the probe fails when the wire breaks at the exit from the probe. Just bought my third one in 10 years. First one died after too much careless handling - don't wind the probe and wire tightly round the unit. Last one suffered the same fate after I shut the probe in the lid of my grill. My bad! At 15 bucks it is worth buying a whole new unit even if replacement probes were available cheaper.
customer_reviews.author: Nick Dray

customer_reviews.title: Failure Prone Sensor
customer_reviews.text: I liked most of the accuracy, convenience, and versatility of this digital thermometer. The achilles heel of this product is the cheap, easily damaged sensor cord. Like other Taylor digital thermometers I have owned, the sensor failed after about 1 year of infrequent use. I have been unable to locate a replacement sensor that does not cost nearly as much as a new unit. This is one more case of ruining an otherwise useful instrument by a flimsy cheap sensor/cord assembly.
customer_reviews.author: conejos

customer_reviews.title: Works for me for years now.
customer_reviews.text: I haven't had issues with this thermometer breaking like others report. I use it maybe 5 times a year, especially for fish, to get a perfect temperature. I love the alarm, and having the readout outside the oven. Boyfriend loves it so I bought him one, too, and I got one for my mom a few years ago. I've had mine now for probably 10 or more years, trouble-free. Given the reviews, be gentle with the probe wires.
customer_reviews.author: NorCalSteph

customer_reviews.title: Used to be good quality, not now
customer_reviews.text: I had this thermometer for 2 months and it no longer keeps temps. It is too late to get a refund, stuck with bad thermometer. I used to get these and they were great, their quality has gone down hill. This is the 3rd one I have had to replace in about 6 months.
customer_reviews.author: sscassie

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and accurate
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the most useful tools in my kitchen. Since the probe is able to go into the oven I have been able to keep meats from drying out. The temp alarm allows you to set the desired temp and forget about the meal until the meat is cooked. Excellent device. This is my second one because after having one for 5+ years, I tried to use it while I was roasting coffee and the excessively high temp messed up the probe. Long battery life.
customer_reviews.author: Brooke

customer_reviews.title: Defective - Battery ruined product
customer_reviews.text: After opening this product, I pulled the clear tab out from under the batteries so they would start working. The thermometer didn't turn on, so I took the battery cover off, and saw that one of the batteries had A HOLE in it. It was a hollow battery; ruined the product. New batteries wouldn't turn the product on. Getting a replacement hoping it was just a rare occurrence.
customer_reviews.author: Chelsea B.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect little thermometer
customer_reviews.text: I had one from ikea that broke within months of using, so I decided to try a new one. Love this! It's magnetic and attaches to my stove for ease of use while cooking and the cord is long enough it reaches. I like that you can set the temperature to sound an alarm at. One of the best cooking tools anyone could have, and this is coming from a pastry Chef.
customer_reviews.author: Katydid

customer_reviews.title: This is the second one of these that I have ...
customer_reviews.text: This is the second one of these that I have purchased. For both, the probe stopped working. The counter top unit held up. The cost of a replacement probe was more than the unit itself. I took care to hand wash just the part you put into the meat. I would not purchase this product.
customer_reviews.author: John King

customer_reviews.title: THERMOMETER READS "HI"
customer_reviews.text: I now have two of these, neither of which work. Both read "HI" instead of giving a temperature. When the first one failed, I bought the second one. I also bought the stainless steel probe, and both of them read HI with that probe. I loved the thermometers when they were working, but now they are useless.
customer_reviews.author: Gary N Ca

customer_reviews.title: Scratched my brand new microwave!!!
customer_reviews.text: We used this digital thermometer for the first time yesterday. I'm skeptical about the temperature reading, as it said that our chicken breasts were 197 degrees, but the chicken was not overcooked. We will give it another chance, however, maybe I'll try the boiling water test like another reviewer did. The biggest disappointment is that the magnets on the back scratched my brand new microwave! If I end up keeping this, I will not be using the magnet feature. So pissed! UPDATE October 26, 2017 Tried the meat thermometer again today on a turkey roast. Temperatures went all over the place and only would read hi or lo. This thing is junk.
customer_reviews.author: macjetta

customer_reviews.title: Wouldn't recommend
customer_reviews.text: Didn't work for very long. We had two and they both started saying "Lo" so we thought it needed new batteries, but that didn't fix it. Compared to the ones we replaced them with, they read very slowly too. Also you have to reset the temp each time - it goes back to something like 124° so we wound up just reading the recommended temp on the back and ignoring the flashing and beeping, just waiting until the right number came up.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsay S

customer_reviews.title: Works for cooking
customer_reviews.text: Works well. No issues so far. Bought 2 so have a spare if one fails. Also, not enthused with the plastic covering the thermostat wire. Concerned it may melt. Didn't at 450°F but sometimes cook roast using closed door oven technique @ 500° for 20-30 minutes. We will see if it holds up at that temp & will update.
customer_reviews.author: Diane F.

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous
customer_reviews.text: Best kitchen gadget to ensure you don't over cook and dry out your food. Pro Tip: take the temperature stuck out of the meat when it's done otherwise you'll yank the thermometer off the counter and break it. Life this item!! I even bought one for my daughter's and a friend. They are thrilled.
customer_reviews.author: Rob Haley

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: The thermometer is very easy to use, easy to read. However, my first experience is a little confusing as the roast was a bit overcooked although I thought I took the roast out prior to inner temperature listed. Not sure if its the thermometer or me. Will try again and update this review.
customer_reviews.author: SAM

customer_reviews.title: Problem with probes...
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately, I have to agree with those who complain about the probe. I've been through three of them and in each case, the probe ultimately fails. The one I have now (not really working) will only read properly if the cord & probe are aligned just right. Otherwise, it's a "Lo" reading and useless. It would be a very good product IF it worked and lasted more than a few uses. Maybe Taylor can do something about beefing up the probes. Until then, two thumbs down.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: WASTE OF MONEY
customer_reviews.text: We had a previous version of this Taylor timer and it worked great for years. That one finally broke, so we ordered this one. Right away, we could tell that the quality of this timer was much less than the previous one. Sure enough, it stopped working after only a couple months. Taylor sent us a replacement since it was still under warranty, but once again, the new one has stopped working properly. Very disappointed by the lower quality of these newer ones, and will be looking for a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah @ Nourished and Nurtured Life

customer_reviews.title: Really bad Probe design
customer_reviews.text: This is the third and LAST Taylor model 1470 N Thermometer I buy, all prebes Gail at the same location the plastic melts and breaks there, see picture, really bad design. A replacement probe will cost you the same as a whole new unit, I guess...... Made in China
customer_reviews.author: Pepe Diaz

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to use thermometer.
customer_reviews.text: I am a food hypochondriac and check the temp of everything I cook! This is a very easy to use thermo and seems accurate. Wish it had a storage for the probe which can be menacing when taking it out of the cabinet, otherwise it is great. One piece of advice, do not drop it on a hard surface. I broke the first one that way.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product for a great price
customer_reviews.text: What an amazing product for an amazing price! I was sceptical about this thermometer being accurate and functionality due to the low price but I was happily surprised. The temperature is accurate, the probe and cable durable and works on grill and in the oven. The large display makes it easy to read, the magnetic back makes it convenient to mount on grill or stove, and the alarm is nice and loud.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Tymon

customer_reviews.title: TEMPERATURE READING NOT ACCURATE
customer_reviews.text: I've ordered a Taylor digital thermometer twice now. The first one stopped working after a year. Then I ordered this one. It never worked from day one. I put it in the beef tenderloin and within minutes, it said it was done! It kept going off. I had to turn it off. Tried it again about a week later...did the same thing. This is totally unreliable!
customer_reviews.author: Robomaz

customer_reviews.title: Loud & Accurate Perfect cooking!
customer_reviews.text: Love this Thermometer! I have been baking with more security knowing my food will not be over cooked or under! It is simple to use. put in the probe select the internal temperature you want and let it bake! It is loud enough to be able to move around the house. this will be the second one I purchase because I need to have one in all the kitchens I cook in!
customer_reviews.author: Thebooklady

customer_reviews.title: Great Deal!
customer_reviews.text: Came across this on sale for under $8 and it works great! It has easy to read panel and very straight forward adjustments where i can quickly just set temperatures or timers. This is great for easy, quick reads. I use it mainly for checking liquids that need to be at a certain temperature. If you are looking for more professional type of thermometers, I would not recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: Lolo

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy
customer_reviews.text: We are very unhappy with this product. After only 2 uses the product stopped working. Do not buy this.
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: Works pretty well and a good price
customer_reviews.text: Even though you have to close the oven door on the cord, this worked well for me. I used my old mercury thermometer in the meat with this one and they were close in temp. Really nice not to have to open the oven door to look at the mercury thermometer any more!
customer_reviews.author: Kentucky Amazoner

customer_reviews.title: It's a wonderful product but it only worked three times then quit
customer_reviews.text: It's a wonderful product but it only worked three times then quit. Loved it for prime rib! The probe needs to be more durable...it read LO, and I didn't realize that it was broken until my roast was nearly done. Fortunately, I took the temp with another manual probe thermometer and was able to save it. Would probably buy again, but wouldn't depend on it after the second or third use. When one spends over $100. on a large prime rib roast, a one-time $16.00 investment is worth it. Don't insert the probe until after the initial very hot sear time in the oven, only insert after you've reduced the oven temp to below 350 degrees.
customer_reviews.author: Mad Libs

customer_reviews.title: Probe breaks, don't buy
customer_reviews.text: I have had several of these and the probes always break or quit. The main body of the thermometer is fine but the probe just quits and you will get a LO or HI on the readout. It would be a simple thing to buy a replacement probe but they are as expensive as an entirely new unit. Pass this one by
customer_reviews.author: otbreso

customer_reviews.title: Probe
customer_reviews.text: The product is great, but the probe sucks. I have a bucket of the thermometer/timers. I check each time I buy a new one and yes indeed, the thermometer (in the body) is still working. But I have some very nice timers. I use it with a barbecue and somewhere along the line, the probe gets caught on something hot and bingo, it stops working and I have to buy a new cooking probe
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: failed after 6 months, used only 20 times
customer_reviews.text: I was happy with this until suddenly it lost accuracy. It now reads about 20 F too low, ruining a meal. I have had several Taylor thermometers without the long probe, never had problems. New batteries didn't help and the cable has no damage.
customer_reviews.author: lcf_guy

customer_reviews.title: It’s okay but there’s better
customer_reviews.text: It’s okay just wish it went up to higher temps. Also would’ve liked if it had a probe holder as I struggled keeping it in one place when getting a read for my oil while cooking. Beeping kept going and couldn’t figure out how to turn it off when it had a set temp. Overall I think there’s better but it’s okay If you wanna be cheap.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan Jay

customer_reviews.title: Great invention bad product !!!
customer_reviews.text: If I had to believe the numbers I was reading I would be in the hospital Dying they were so Inaccurate !!! I had to use me old machine to get a Accurate measurement now I’m stuck with it collecting dust because I can use it !!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Never overcook your meats again
customer_reviews.text: This is the second digital cooking thermometer I've owned from Taylor. I use this when I smoke meats or roasts in the oven. It's extremely accurate and the temperature alarm is a nice feature. I have yet to overcook anything since I purchased this. Be careful when inserting or removing and that you don't pinch the part where the cord meats the metal probe as this can cause malfunction. For this price, it's a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Krazybartender

customer_reviews.title: Five dollars for ten dollars of quality.
customer_reviews.text: An ounce better than the cheaper model, this thermometer does what's expected and is pretty reliable about it. Haven't had any misreads or detection issues; at first was skeptical to use a silicone-coated cord in the oven but it seems to work perfectly fine. Previous thermometer was the same brand, five dollars cheaper. It did the job well and had a flex-weave metal coating on the probe wire. "Alarm" is just a bit less loud than the cheaper model, but the magnets on this one are what make it extra nice; it'll stick to your stove and never move, quite contrary to the issue I had with the smaller one.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Pagliarini

customer_reviews.title: Not accurate - UPDATED 5/6/14-Very happy now
customer_reviews.text: I have had this model in the past and they have always been wonderful. This one is very inaccurate. I put it in the thickest chicken breast, when it reads 165, I check with a different thermometer, and that one reads 145. I have only used this new one 3 times, and unfortunately it is too late to return it. UPDATE: 5/5 I read the comment from Taylor and emailed them, explaining the situation. 5/6 I received an email back, offering to replace the thermometer. I will definitely order their products in the future. Wonderful customer service. Update: 5/12/14 - Received a new one in the mail. Works beautifully. Very happy with the wonderful customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Gypsy

customer_reviews.title: Priced right if it meets your needs
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for something to put in my roast and leave door shut until done. Not going to happen with this thermometer. Not to be left in oven during cooking. Not to be used with oven temps higher than 392°F. It does work within given parameters just fine.
customer_reviews.author: A dad that tries

customer_reviews.title: Great Thermometer for a Variety of uses
customer_reviews.text: This is a great thermometer that has a timer built in. We use it for making yogurt, cheese, and bread. It also comes in handy for checking the doneness of meats and other dishes. We have one on the ventahood and another magnetically attached to a refrigerator where it’s handy. Our only complaint is that the probe tends to stop working far sooner that it ought to. But the newer ones seem to be doing better. Buying a new probe costs as much as buying a whole new thermometer.
customer_reviews.author: Lenny Findley

customer_reviews.title: Not well built like they used to be
customer_reviews.text: These used to be great thermometers. But I bought 2 and they both stopped working after only about a month. The low stays on the screen even after I replace the batteries so this is no use to me other than a timer. Also, it doesn’t save recently used temperatures so you have to slowly click through each time to set the desired temp.
customer_reviews.author: Kendra E. Gray

customer_reviews.title: I love this timer better than any other timer I've had
customer_reviews.text: I love this timer better than any other timer I've had. Why? It beeps every minute after the time is up so if I'm zoned out or distant during the first ring, I catch one of the following beeps. I have two of these, and no brain. So I put one timer right next to the thing I'm supposed to remember, and when I go to turn it off on ring 2 or 5 or 10, , there is my project/food/phone right beside it, so I remember why it's ringing, and I'm ready to go! I think I'll buy a third one!
customer_reviews.author: L. N. Davis

customer_reviews.title: Kitchen Must Have
customer_reviews.text: I use this almost every day. Takes the guess work out of cooking meat, and is extremely easy to use. Can't beat the quality of this item for this price. Someday when my children destroy this thing somehow, or a jealous house guest steals it, I will definitely buy another.
customer_reviews.author: Kami C

customer_reviews.title: It just stopped working
customer_reviews.text: This is an update for my review. I’ve had this less than a year and it already stopped working. It turns on but it won’t read once you insert the thermometer. I tried changing the batteries but it didn’t help.
customer_reviews.author: S Sevilla

customer_reviews.title: Accurate, flexible, and efficient
customer_reviews.text: Ordered as a replacement for an older version that was too worn out. Couldn’t be more pleased. I like the newer cord design that has the silicone outer wrapping instead of the braided metal weave that was in the prior version. We use this to cook chicken, turkey, and to measure temperature when using a dehydrator. It is well calibrated according to my thermal read infrared thermometer as well as a second digital thermometer that was used as a test. Highly recommended
customer_reviews.author: Dean Harmon

customer_reviews.title: A Kitchen Essential
customer_reviews.text: There's no concern about over cooking or under cooking with this thermometer. Insert the probe, close the oven door and place the easy-to-read thermometer on the counter. The wire is long enough to reach.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy L. Otto

customer_reviews.title: Probes available from Taylor for $5, free shipping
customer_reviews.text: Used it for the first time and the probe worked for 10 min at 130F then just showed 'Lo'. Found they now sell replacements at TaylorUSA for $5 and no shipping. At least I can try another without buying another device.
customer_reviews.author: Jill H.

customer_reviews.title: These are great thermometers while they last
customer_reviews.text: These are great thermometers while they last. I've owned several and the sensor wire breaks near the probe end within a couple of years. While they work, they're great. One of the nicest features is that you can leave the probe in the food while its cooking, so you know exactly how it's doing. It pretty much does everything you'd want, except last. Replacement probes are available, but they cost nearly as much as the full set. I'll continue buying them until I find something with similar features and is more durable.
customer_reviews.author: NoVA Music Lover

customer_reviews.title: works great, short life.
customer_reviews.text: works great! temperature is easy to read. Easy to figure out how it works. Low price. All good things, except the Achilles Heel of the unit is the temp limits on the probe. I never take my smoker above 300 degrees, and the probe failed after 5 uses. From all the other reviews, I suspect I'm not the only one. The replacement cost for the probe is the same or more than the thermometer was new! I'm thinking I may need to look for a higher quality thermometer in hopes it will last longer and I won't be filling the dump with perfectly good thermometers that have no working probes. Keep looking....
customer_reviews.author: Redbenflies

customer_reviews.title: Good thermometer. It’s great for cooking
customer_reviews.text: Good thermometer. It’s great for cooking. It’s a second one we own and use all the time. Only thing is our first one stop reading due to the sensor stop working. It was cheaper to just by the whole thing but it’s farely inexpensive so i give it a 4 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Awesome Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this unit because it was similar to one I had owned before, and it was inexpensive. Bad decision. The timer on the unit stopped working during a cook (wasn’t using the temp probe...only the timer). Tried to reset the timer, but the buttons wouldn’t work. Even after turning the unit off and back on, still wouldn’t reset. Tossed it in the trash.
customer_reviews.author: Mitch

customer_reviews.title: Great value vs
customer_reviews.text: I bought this thermometer to replace an older Taylor that had an intermittent short in the probe. After doing some research, it seems that the 'one battery' version of the probe is different than the 'two battery' version of the probe. Ultimately, the probe was within a few dollars of an entire thermometer with probe. The build of the new unit is similar to the old. The power switch on the new unit feels much cheaper than the old, and significantly cheaper than the remainder of the new unit. Given the price, and how many years of service the old unit provided - if it fails, I'll just buy another. Great value vs. purchasing the item locally.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Homrighausen

customer_reviews.title: cheap = you get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: piece of crap like all china stuff. sensor breaks after 10 usues. guess what they all break after 10 uses. new probe $11 new probe and unit 7.99.. works great befor they break. I will be buying another one..but if your were stranded on a island and needed it to work for years this is not the one to get
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Use this thermometer if you're pouring candles!!
customer_reviews.text: I pour scented soy candles and this is the best thermometer I've used so far. The alarm feature allows me to work on other stages while waiting for wax temp to rise. The probe sits easily in any container I melt wax in (from glass espresso pots to my 8 pound Presto pour pot). My only wish is for the alarm to work backwards and alert me when it falls to a certain temp. This hasn't happened to me but I've read the probe stops working and it's $$ to replace.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. Peel

customer_reviews.title: Does Not Read Temperature with Any Accuracy
customer_reviews.text: This does not work at all. It measured a turkey breast to have reached temp after it was in the oven for 20 minutes. I've tried it twice more, once for roasted rabbit, once for a meatloaf. Totally off. I thought maybe I needed to calibrate it, so I put it in cold water, etc. Still off. It measured the ambient temperature perfectly fine. Total waste of money, I'm just going back to my simple old meat thermometer.
customer_reviews.author: ToShop

customer_reviews.title: The probe is the weakest part.
customer_reviews.text: I want to love this thermometer but the probe’s wire come out from the metal part real easy. I had another one that the probe wire broke after about 20 uses. The last one the wire came out from the probe after 2 uses. Too bad this could have been a 4 star chef thermometer but the probe is a lemon. Thumbs down.
customer_reviews.author: Hockey & Chopin

customer_reviews.title: Worthless
customer_reviews.text: This is useless because it does not register the correct temperature. It will signal that the desired temperature is reached which is considered to be done and the food will still be raw. Don't waste your money on this.
customer_reviews.author: B. Colquett

customer_reviews.title: terrible graphics
customer_reviews.text: Had one a couple of years ago. worked great. this model, same as my last, has terrible graphics where you cannot read the 'on or off' or any other print. everything is the same color. Gray. Who decided that the print color should be the same as the background color? the unit works good but very frustrating to use.
customer_reviews.author: Tony_c

customer_reviews.title: Never cook by time, use Temp!
customer_reviews.text: My first Turkey and Prime Rib came out amazing. Don't know why anyone cooks large meats by using a timer instead of temperature. Don't need to cut into the meat to check doneness anymore, which ruins the meat. You need to let it set for a while before cutting in or else it gets dry! I used to overcook my meat b/c I was afraid it wasn't done. My mom has been an amazing cook for my entire life but dad asked her to buy one, so I got it for her as a gift. Had to watch a YouTube video to put it in the right spot in the Turkey.
customer_reviews.author: OrdersALot

customer_reviews.title: I've had two of these and the probes go bad.
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to use & liked the audible alarm. Could also manually set any desired cooking temp. Probes fail, unit appears to still work, but without a probe it's useless.
customer_reviews.author: Mike RPh

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working.  Had since November 2017 with normal use it just stopped working August 2019.
customer_reviews.text: I would think it should have lasted more time. It just stopped working. I changed battery. Pressed reset button. Still did not work!
customer_reviews.author: Delosmom

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value!
customer_reviews.text: Just bought this thermometer to replace a much more expensive one that broke in less then a year. Used it 3 times so far and my meat came out perfect each time. You cannot go wrong for the price.
customer_reviews.author: D. Belliveau

customer_reviews.title: Works Well
customer_reviews.text: It is very easy to use, and the price is less than the cost of a replacement probe for our old one. In fact, the probe worked with the old one, so it's worth buying as a replacement probe!
customer_reviews.author: Erikrose

customer_reviews.title: Does not work.
customer_reviews.text: Was using it to monitor maple sap production. Worked for a short time the would not measure temperature. When the temperature reached 212 would immediately jump up to 225. This is my second attemp with this product both did the same thing. I am assuming that it cannot be used for continuous measuring temperature.
customer_reviews.author: mike

customer_reviews.title: I love this thermometer because it actually works and tells me ...
customer_reviews.text: I love this thermometer because it actually works and tells me the temperature of what I'm cooking!! I would definitely recommend this Taylor Digital Cooking Probe Thermometer to any cook over the other "pencil" time thermometers. I can't ever get good temperature readings form those. I'm very glad I got this Taylor Digital Cooking Probe.
customer_reviews.author: D. Robertson

customer_reviews.title: Works great you can just leave it on it'll keep the settings in place..
customer_reviews.text: Works great has a lot of great features. One being it stays on Fahrenheit doesn't switch back to centigrade you can leave this on 24/7 never have to shut it off low drain battery.
customer_reviews.author: Greatwill

customer_reviews.title: perfect temp on my stick
customer_reviews.text: If you never used one, this is a simple device to cook your meat perfect everytime. This is an older model that has been around for years and always reliable until your batteries wear out. It has a long life though and used my thermometer for 2 years. Now if I can only get my sister to use it when she BBQ. I use it on the grill after I make my first turn on the steaks, then close the lid until the alarm goes off. have a perfectly cooked steak everytime. no guess work, perfect on the grill. Works well in the oven as well when cooking a roast in the oven or even the Thanksgiving turkey. Perfect everytime.
customer_reviews.author: Tommy of Richmond

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Kitchen Tool
customer_reviews.text: Hangs on the fridge to be used as a timer. But when you need an internal temp check, pop it off and get a quick and accurate read. You can even leave in a hunk of meat in the oven or resting in oil to keep track of temp. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: JR

product_meta.title: Taylor Precision Products Digital Cooking Probe Thermometer and Timer, Pack of 1
product_meta.description:
Style Name:1470The Taylor digital cooking probe thermometer/timer provides superior results For professional and amateur chefs alike. This digital meat Thermometer accurately measures temperatures from 32 to 392 °F. A durable stainless steel probe with a 4 ft. Silicone cord allows food to be easily monitored without removing it from the oven. Additional features include an automatic time and temperature alarm so you can gauge how much time is left before It's time to eat. The cooking thermometer also features a stand-up display for countertop use, or a magnet for attachment to an oven door. 2 AAA batteries are included.

AMAZON.COM
Opening the oven to check on a food's temperature means wasting the cook's time and losing oven temperature and moisture--not to mention a face full of steam. This thermometer prevents those problems. Insert the instrument's 6-inch stainless-steel probe into a roast beef or turkey and monitor the time and temperature (from 32 to 392 degrees F) on the thermometer's large digital display, which connects to the probe with a 4-foot cord. The control panel sets cooking time and temperature, and an alarm sounds when either is reached. Fully opened, the thermometer/timer is 5 inches high, but it folds flat for compact storage. Magnets on the back permit it to be temporarily mounted on a metal surface. --Fred Brack
feature_bullets: Monitor food without removing it from the oven: durable stainless steel probe with a 4-foot silicone cord allows monitoring of food inside oven without opening the door.
Programmable temperature and timer alarm: set the target temperature and monitor the ACTUAL temperature on the display. Also has timer feature that has a range up to 24 hours.
Versatile design: this cooking thermometer can be kept at an angle, or laid flat to be seen in any cooking environment.
Highly accurate: this digital thermometer measures temperatures from 32°F to 392°f, 0°C to 200°c.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.2 out of 5 stars4,185 ratings4.2 out of 5 stars
